discussion.content:
Its A, question is for %shares, the reservation and limit don't change, but %shares does.
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.5/com.vmware.vsphere.resmgmt.doc/GUID-D1DEFECE-7C3D-4A01-9064-35B9E391B58A.html
A is the correct answer. I even tested it in our VMware environment

B - When you move a virtual machine to a new resource pool:
The virtual machine’s reservation and limit do not change.
If the virtual machine’s shares are high, medium, or low, %Shares adjusts to reflect the total number of shares in use in the new resource pool.

Correct Answer! A

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.7/com.vmware.vsphere.resmgmt.doc/GUID-D1DEFECE-7C3D-4A01-9064-35B9E391B58A.html

comments.content: This note is for CUSTOM SHARES only. So it is A

discussion.content:
Note:
Because share allocations are relative to a resource pool, you might have to manually change a virtual machine’s shares when you move it into a resource pool so that the virtual machine’s shares are consistent with the relative values in the new resource pool. A warning appears if a virtual machine would receive a very large (or very small) percentage of total shares.

I tested in VMware labs on hands, and it doesn't change. Both reservation and shares doesn't change. So it's B
Correct it's B

choices.A: The VM share value (%Shares) adjusts to the Resource Pool.

So, to clear this big discussion. I passed the exam today, and the question had (Choose two.) at the end which isn't written here. So there are 2 answers. I got 489/500 so I dont know if maybe I answer this question wrong. My answer was AB
AB is correct at exam. Passed with 500.

A and B, the cache and storage tiers are not 2 options, they are a combined option and results in either a Hybrid or All Flash, and since you cannot have more than 1 SSD for the cache tiers options C and D are invalid.

Answer is A & B.

Select the host and click Create disk group.Then select the flash device to be used for cache.Then select the type of capacity disks to use, depending on the type of disk group you want to create (HDD for hybrid or Flash for all-flash).

You must use 1 flash (SSD) for the cache, and 1 SSD or HDD for the capacity.

vSAN Hybird and All-Flash Disk Configuration
ANS : AB

choices.D: 2 or more SSD drives for the caching tier and 2 or more SSDs for the capacity tier
choices.C: 2 or more SSD drives for the caching tier and 2 or more HDDs for the capacity tier
choices.B: 1 SSD drive for the caching tier and 1 or more HDDs for the capacity tier
choices.A: 1 SSD drive for the caching tier and 1 or more SSDs for the capacity tier

questions.question_text:
A vSphere administrator cannot mount an NFS datastore.
Which three actions can be performed to troubleshoot the issue? (Choose three.)

choices.B: Run esxcli storage nfs list and ensure that the NFS filesystem is etx44 or reiserFS.
choices.E: Ensure that the access on the NFS server is set to Anonymous user, Root Access (no_root_squash), and Read/Write.
choices.C: Run the nc ""z array-IP 2049 command in the ESXi Shell to see whether the ESHi host can reach the NFS server nfsd TCP/UDP port (default 2049) on the storage array.
choices.D: Ensure that the ESXi host can vmkping the NFS server address.
choices.A: Verify that the CHAP authentication settings are correct.
